revised_title: Observations and Analysis of Tidal Phenomena in the Irish Sea
tldr: This article reports on observations made on tides in the Irish Sea and the similarities of tidal phenomena between the Irish and English Channels. The author describes the course of the tides, the rate of water flow, and the importance of extending these experiments to improve navigation and understanding of tidal phenomena. The author also provides a chart of lines of equal range of tide to help seamen determine the amount of spring tide they need to adapt their soundings to.
